key_title: Key to the species of Dillwynia

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves distinctly pungent
Leaves never pungent but sometimes acuminate
Leaves distinctly petiolate, spreading or inclined to stems, rarely reflexed
Leaves sessile, spreading or reflexed
Leaves spirally twisted, inclined to stems; tall shrub from the Grampians
Leaves never spirally twisted, usually spreading; rare shrub of northern and eastern Victoria
Plant erect, decumbent or procumbent, never completely prostrate; branches never rooting at nodes
Plant prostrate; branches often rooting at nodes; rare plant of East Gippsland
Leaves never spirally twisted
Leaves spirally twisted
Flowers solitary or paired in axils
Flowers mostly in axillary or terminal clusters of 3 or more
Stems glabrous, often spinescent; flowers mostly single; localized shrub of central Victoria
Stems densely covered with spreading or appressed hairs, not spinescent; flowers mostly in pairs; widespread, variable shrub

Calyx gradually tapered to base, glabrous or with scattered spreading hairs (rarely appressed-pubescent), upper 2 lobes distinct although sometimes shallowly cleft; flower clusters often long-pedunculate; corolla deciduous

Calyx abruptly tapered at base, moderately to densely covered with short appressed hairs, upper 2 lobes not or hardly distinct, appearing as a broad, truncate or slightly indented lip; flower clusters not long-pedunculate; corolla persistent in fruit
Flowers predominantly yellow; upper 2 lobes of calyx blunt; leaves usually glabrous, slender, to 3 cm long
Flowers predominantly red or orange; upper 2 lobes of calyx acute; leaves often hispid, thickish, rarely exceeding 1 cm in length
Leaves rather crowded, at least toward ends of branches, slender, straight or slightly recurved near apex, to c. 3 cm long; widespread shrub
Leaves scattered, thickish, recurved, usually under 1 cm long; twiggy shrub of north-west mallee
